section.para: &nation_name; was founded as part of an Abadarian religious crusade, and its roots are still apparent to this day. Although the nation is not strictly aligned with any one deity, its senate is composed of eighteen representatives from the most influential temples—be it influence through number of worshipers, wealth, or other means. Currently the temples of Abadar, Shelyn, Cayden Cailean, Sarenrae, Pharasma, Iomedae, and Erastil hold senate positions. The temple of Abadar has maintained major power in the city, and from the gilded halls of &abadar_temple; in &law_city; it oversees much of the nation's financial and legal well-being. Shelyn and Cayden Cailean both have large followings in &arts_city;, and their temples—&shelyn_temple; and &cc_temple;—draw tourists and worshippers from far and wide.

Iomedae's temple is the &police_hq; in &law_city; and much of the police force are devotees. Sarenrae, Pharasma, and Erastil enjoy large popular support from all around the nation for their public services and good works, but they do not maintain large shrines or temples in any one location. Many other faiths have worshippers in &nation_name;, and although they do not hold prominent political power, Desna, Gozreh, Calistria, and Irori all have noteworthy followings in various places around the country.
